alert.note: Alert for Orange (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 4:21PM EDT until June 26 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey and southeast New York, including the following counties, in northeast New Jersey, Passaic. In southeast New York, Orange. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving into the area from northeastern New Jersey. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen across part of the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over much of the area, with locally 3 inches possible. This additional rain will result in minor flooding, with localized flash flooding possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newburgh, Middletown, West Milford, Ringwood, Pompton Lakes, Port Jervis, Monroe, Walden, Warwick, Goshen, Howells, New Windsor, Bloomingdale, Gardnertown, Chester, Montgomery, Greenwood Lake, Florida, Harriman and Cuddebackville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
